title: Disconnection Times
fullText: The maximum disconnection time for a 230 V supply voltage shall not exceed the following:

conditions: socket-outlets having rated currents not exceeding 63 A
portable equipment intended for manual movement during use

requirements.applicability: for other circuits where it can be shown that people are not exposed to touch voltages that exceed safe values.
requirements.reference: Refer to Appendix B, Paragraph B4.

notes: Maximum disconnection times will vary for other operating voltages or installation conditions, such as wet locations, etc.
The fault current has to be of sufficient magnitude to cause automatic disconnection within the required times.
